009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.add;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
014import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.subtract;
015import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.transpose;
016import static java.lang.Math.abs;
017import static java.lang.Math.copySign;
018import static java.lang.Math.cos;
019import static java.lang.Math.sin;
020
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022
023/**
024 * Abstract superclass of ellipse projectors, used to find the
025 * closest "contact" point on an ellipse for some given target point.
026 * Defines specific methods for calculating the distance only, 
027 * without returning the point itself.
028 */
029public abstract class EllipseProjector {
030        
031        private final double[] xc;
032        private final double[][] R, Rt;                 // rotation matrix
033        
034        protected EllipseProjector(GeometricEllipse ellipse) {
035                this.xc = new double[] {ellipse.xc, ellipse.yc};
036                this.R = new double[][]
037                                {{ cos(ellipse.theta), -sin(ellipse.theta) }, 
038                                 { sin(ellipse.theta),  cos(ellipse.theta) }};
039                this.Rt = transpose(R);
040        }
041        
042        // methods to be implemented by subclasses ----------------------------
043        
044        /**
045         * Calculates the projection point in canonical coordinates.
046         * 
047         * @param u1 target point in canonical coordinates.
048         * @return the associated "contact" point on the ellipse
049         */
050        protected abstract double[] projectCanonical(double[] u1);
051        
052        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        /**
055         * Projects the specified point onto the associated ellipse.
056         * 
057         * @param x the 2D point to be projected
058         * @return the closest point on the ellipse
059         */
060        public double[] project(double[] x) {
061                double[] u = toCanonicalFrame(x);                                       // target point in u/v coordinates
062                double[] u1 = toFirstQuadrant(u);                                       // target point in quadrant 1
063                double[] ub1 = projectCanonical(u1);                            // contact point in quadrant 1
064                double[] ub = fromFirstQuadrant(ub1, u);                        // contact point in u/v coordinates
065                return this.fromCanonicalFrame(ub);                                     // contact point in x/y coordinates
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Projects the specified point onto the associated ellipse.
070         * 
071         * @param pnt the 2D point to be projected
072         * @return the closest point on the ellipse
073         */
074        public Pnt2d project(Pnt2d pnt) {
075                return Pnt2d.from(project(pnt.toDoubleArray()));
076        }
077        
078        /**
079         * Calculates the distance to the closest ellipse point
080         * (but not the point itself).
081         * @param x the 2D point to be projected
082         * @return the distance to the closest ellipse point
083         */
084        public double getDistance(double[] x) {
085                return Math.sqrt(getDistanceSq(x));                     // d = ||u1 - ub1||
086        }
087        
088        public double getDistanceSq(double[] x) {
089                double[] u = toCanonicalFrame(x);                                       // target point in u/v coordinates
090                double[] u1 = toFirstQuadrant(u);                                       // target point in quadrant 1
091                double[] ub1 = projectCanonical(u1);                            // contact point in quadrant 1
092                return sqr(u1[0] - ub1[0]) + sqr(u1[1] - ub1[1]);       // = ||u1 - ub1||^2
093//              return Matrix.normL2squared(Matrix.subtract(u1, ub1));
094        }       
095
096        // internal methods projecting points to/from canonical coordinates:
097        
098        protected double[] toCanonicalFrame(double[] xy) {
099                return multiply(Rt, subtract(xy, xc)); // point in canonical coordinates
100        }
101        
102        protected double[] fromCanonicalFrame(double[] uv) {
103                return add(multiply(R, uv), xc);
104        }
105        
106        protected double[] toFirstQuadrant(double[] uv) {
107                return new double[] {abs(uv[0]), abs(uv[1])};
108        }
109        
110        protected double[] fromFirstQuadrant(double[] uv, double[] uvOrig) {
111                return new double[] {copySign(uv[0], uvOrig[0]), copySign(uv[1], uvOrig[1])};
112        }
113
114
115}
